results.title: Does the sympathetic nervous system influence sinus arrhythmia in man? Evidence from combined autonomic blockade.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ alone prolonged the mean R-R interval and increased @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmia_Sinus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001146 @@@sinus arrhythmia@@@.

citations.NLM: Coker R, Koziell A, Oliver C, Smith SE. Does the sympathetic nervous system influence sinus arrhythmia in man? Evidence from combined autonomic blockade. J Physiol. 1984 Nov;356():459-64. PMID: 6520795
citations.BibTeX: @article{6520795, title={Does the sympathetic nervous system influence sinus arrhythmia in man? Evidence from combined autonomic blockade.}, author={Coker R and Koziell A and Oliver C and Smith SE}, journal={J Physiol}, volume={356}, pages={459-64}}

results.title: Beta-adrenoceptor antagonists increase sinus arrhythmia, a vagotonic effect.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ alone prolonged the mean R-R interval and increased @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmia_Sinus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001146 @@@sinus arrhythmia@@@.

citations.NLM: Bittiner SB, Smith SE. Beta-adrenoceptor antagonists increase sinus arrhythmia, a vagotonic effect. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1986 Dec;22(6):691-5. PMID: 2882771
citations.BibTeX: @article{2882771, title={Beta-adrenoceptor antagonists increase sinus arrhythmia, a vagotonic effect.}, author={Bittiner SB and Smith SE}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={22}, number={6}, pages={691-5}}

results.title: Cardiac and behavioral effects of social isolation and experimental manipulation of autonomic balance.
results.text_hl: Autonomic receptor antagonism by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ led to exaggerated reductions in heart rate and standard deviation of normal-to-normal intervals, and lower amplitude of @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmia_Sinus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001146 @@@respiratory sinus arrhythmia@@@ in the isolated group (vs. paired).

citations.NLM: Grippo AJ, Scotti ML, Wardwell J, McNeal N, Bates SL, Chandler DL, Ihm E, Jadia N. Cardiac and behavioral effects of social isolation and experimental manipulation of autonomic balance. Auton Neurosci. 2018 Nov;214():1-8. PMID: 30177218
citations.BibTeX: @article{30177218, title={Cardiac and behavioral effects of social isolation and experimental manipulation of autonomic balance.}, author={Grippo AJ and Scotti ML and Wardwell J and McNeal N and Bates SL and Chandler DL and Ihm E and Jadia N}, journal={Auton Neurosci}, volume={214}, pages={1-8}}

results.title: Effect of antihypertensive drug therapy on short-term heart rate variability in newly diagnosed essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: We interpret the increase in HF RR interval spectral power in the @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-treated group as being due to an increase in vagal modulation of RR intervals and/or diminution in sympathetic restraint of @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmia_Sinus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001146 @@@respiratory sinus arrhythmia@@@.

citations.NLM: Pavithran P, Prakash ES, Dutta TK, Madanmohan T. Effect of antihypertensive drug therapy on short-term heart rate variability in newly diagnosed essential hypertension. Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol. 2010 Feb;37(2):e107-13. PMID: 19769606
citations.BibTeX: @article{19769606, title={Effect of antihypertensive drug therapy on short-term heart rate variability in newly diagnosed essential hypertension.}, author={Pavithran P and Prakash ES and Dutta TK and Madanmohan T}, journal={Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol}, volume={37}, number={2}, pages={e107-13}}
